Question: 40 year old male with newly diagnosed moderate UC and articular extraintestinal manifestations
Reasoning: IFX is ideal choice as biologically naïve with EIM.

Question: 70 year old female with newly diagnosed severe UC
Reasoning: Given advanced age, IFX not preferred as first choice

Question: 35 year old male with known moderate UC with prior exposure to infliximab but has worsening colitis on endoscopy despite compliance
Reasoning: Testing 2nd line treatment to patients previously exposed to anti-TNFa

Question: 60 year old female with newly diagnosed moderate UC with a background of congestive cardiac failure
Reasoning: Testing contraindications to first line IFX. TFC not recommended because of increased LDL-C and MACE risk

Question: 38 year old female with newly diagnosed moderate UC and psoriasis
Reasoning: Test treatment of specific EIM and IBD

Question: 25 year old pregnant woman with severe distal ulcerative colitis.
Reasoning: Infliximab has best safety data in pregnancy (due to experience)

Question: 56 year old man with moderatie to severe ulcerative colitis and ankylosing spondylitis
Reasoning: Dual indications

Question: 38 year old man with severe ulcerative colitis and has lost response to vedolizumab
Reasoning: Biologic failure

Question: 28 year old woman who has severe extensive ulcerative colitis and has a history of lymphoma which was treated 4 years ago
Reasoning: Anti-TNFs and JAK inhs have associations/concerns with malignancies

Question: 36 year old woman with moderate ulcerative colitis and multiple sclerosis.
Reasoning: Dual indications

Question: 39 year-old male with moderate to severe extensive ulcerative colitis who had malignant melanoma which was treated 3 years ago
Reasoning: Anti-TNFs and JAK inhs have associations/concerns with malignancies

Question: 52 year-old woman with moderate to severe distal ulcerative colitis that had a successful induction with vedolizumab. What would be the maintenance therapy?
Recommendation 2: Any other biologic but not ideal
Reasoning: Some maintenance biologic as induction biologic

Question: 24 year-old man with moderate to severe extensive ulcerative colitis previously in clinical remission with infliximab develops loss of response due to antibody formation.
Reasoning: Immunogenic failure. Can consider changing to another anti-TNF class

Question: 44 year-old woman with moderate to severe extensive ulcerative colitis and rheumatoid arthritis.
Reasoning: Dual use

Question: 55 year-old man with moderate to severe extensive ulcerative colitis who avlues convenience and limited time spent in hospital
Reasoning: Subcutaneous and oral options

Question: 60 year-old woman with severe ulcerative colitis that has loss response to anti-TNF, vedolizumab and ustekinumab
Reasoning: Last line agents. Dual biologics use is possible.

Question: 36 year-old man with moderate to severe extensive ulcerative colitis and spondylarthristis.
Reasoning: Dual indications

Question: 42 year-old woman with moderate ulcerative colitis on azathioprine and not responding to therapy
Reasoning: Combination therapy

Question: 53 year-old man with moderate to severe extensive ulcerative colitis and low albumin levels
Reasoning: Low serum albumin associated with poorer resonse to anti-TNFs (especially Infliximab)

Question: 42 year-old woman with severe ulcerative colitis and rare fistulating disease
Reasoning: No real data on ulcerative colitis - related fistula

Question: 68 year-old man with extensive moderate to severe ulcerative colitis who has prostate cancer which has been treated 5 years ago.
Reasoning: Anti-TNFs and JAK inhs have associations/concerns with malignancies

Question: 25 year-old man with extensive moderate to severe ulcerative colitis and primary sclerosing cholangitis with decompensated cirrhosis.
Reasoning: Low/No evidence here

Question: 48 year-old woman with distal moderate to severe ulcerative colitis who prioritizes a rapid response to treatment.
Reasoning: Infliximab and Tofacitinib have the quickest response

Question: 36 year-old woman with moderate to severe ulcerative colitis who has lost response to tofacitinib.
Reasoning: VDZ doesn’t do well as 2nd line

Question: 18 year-old man with moderate to severe extensive ulcerative colitis and pyoderma gangrenosum.
Reasoning: Dual indications

Question: 58 year-old woman with moderate to severe distal ulcerative colitis and optic neuritis.
Reasoning: Anti-TNFs are contraindicated

Question: 55 year-old man with moderate to severe extensive ulcerative colitis and colonic polyps with high grade dysplasia found 2 years ago.
Reasoning: ?? No idea

Question: 27 year-old woman with moderate to severe extensive ulcerative colitis who prefers medication with oral formulation.
Reasoning: Only oral formulation

Question: 41 year-old man with moderate to severe distal ulcerative colitis and alocpecia areata.
Reasoning: JAK inhibitors can be used for alopecia areata

Question: 38 year-old woman with moderate to severe ulcerative colitis and pulmonary tuberculosis which was treated 2 years ago.
Reasoning: Anti-TNFs and JAK inhs have associations/concerns with infections
